title: Walmarts second Black Friday sale is live: Get a $149 Apple Watch SE, a $178 55-inch 4K Roku TV, and more
description: The best deals from Walmart's second Black Friday Deals event include a $149 Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen), $178 55-inch Roku TV, and $29 JLab headphones.
excerpt: After five hours of early access for Walmart+ members, the deals are now open to all shoppers.
text: After five hours of early access for Walmart+ members, the deals are now open to all shoppers. All products featured here are independently selected by our editors and writers. If you buy something through links on our site, Mashable may earn an affiliate commission. Credit: Stacey Zhu / Walmart / Mashable composite Table of Contents UPDATE: Nov. 25, 2024, 5:00 p.m. EST This story has been updated to reflect that Walmart's Black Friday Deals event is now live for all shoppers. Walmart's best Black Friday deals at a glance: Walmart's second Black Friday Deals event kicked off on Monday, Nov. 25 with a $178 55-inch 4K Roku TV, $29 JBL noise-cancelling headphones, and new record-low prices on several Apple gadgets: the AirPods Pro 2 (now $154), the second-generation Apple Watch SE (now $149), the 10th-gen iPad (now $259), the first-gen Apple Pencil (now $59), and the M1 MacBook Air (now $599).The deals went live on Walmart's website and mobile app at 12 p.m. ET for paid members of its Walmart+ program, then opened to all shoppers at 5 p.m. ET. Several products sold out during the Walmart+ early access period Monday, including $99.99 Beats Solo4 headphones, Lego's The Office set for $70, and $30 copies of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom.The remaining deals will be up for grabs online through Sunday, Dec. 1 (unless they sell out first) and make their way to stores at 6 a.m. local time on Nov. 29, aka Black Friday proper. The big-box store joins other major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target in dropping Black Friday deals well ahead of the actual holiday.Mashable's team of deal-hunting pros knows how to distinguish good discounts from duds (having covered Black Friday sales since 2017), and we're keeping a running list of Walmart's top holiday deals on popular tech and gifts this season. That includes TVs, laptops, headphones, gaming gear, vacuums, beauty tech, and Legos.Keep scrolling to see our picks — and check back often, as Walmart plans to drop additional deals randomly throughout the week as its Black Friday Deals event progresses. A quick FYI that Walmart doesn't do price matches, but its extended return/exchange policy is in effect through Dec. 31. It covers most items purchased in stores and online. was live online from Monday, Nov. 11 through Sunday, Nov. 17, popping up in stores on Friday, Nov. 15. The sale included doorbusters like a $138 50-inch 4K TV, a $378 75-inch 4K TV, heavily discounted refurbished Dyson hair tools (which sold out fast), a $30 Keurig, $69 Beats headphones, and all-time lows on the new Apple Watch Series 10, the AirPods 3, the Apple AirTag, and the Dyson V12 Detect Slim. (That's Mashable's favorite Dyson vacuum.) Walmart stores will be open from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. local time on Black Friday (Nov. 29). The doorbusters from its Black Friday Deals event won't be available in-person until then.Walmart stores will be closed on Thanksgiving. Walmart will conclude its holiday programming with a Cyber Monday sale that starts on Sunday, Dec. 1 at 5 p.m. ET for Walmart+ members and 8 p.m. ET for everyone else. That event will run through Cyber Monday proper on Dec. 2 and feature the following deals, among many others:Sony 75-inch Class Bravia 4K TV — $898 $1,498 (Save $600)Ninja Grand Kitchen System 1200 — $98 (Special Buy)Cricut Air 2 Bundle — $179 $269 (save $90)Intex 6-Person PureSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Spa Set — $499.99 $749.99 (save $250)Lego Star Wars Darth Vader Helmet — $48.98 $79.99 (save $31.01) Haley Henschel is a Chicago-based Senior Shopping Reporter at Mashable who reviews and finds deals on popular tech, from laptops to gaming consoles and VPNs. She has years of experience covering shopping holidays and can tell you what’s actually worth buying on Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day. Her work has also explored the driving forces behind digital trends within the shopping sphere, from dupes to 12-foot skeletons.Haley received a B.A. in Journalism from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and honed her sifting and winnowing skills at The Daily Cardinal. She previously covered politics for The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, investigated exotic pet ownership for Wisconsin Watch, and blogged for some of your favorite reality stars.In her free time, Haley enjoys playing video games, drawing, taking walks on Lake Michigan, and spending time with her parrot (Melon) and dog (Pierogi). html:
After five hours of early access for Walmart+ members, the deals are now open to all shoppers.

All products featured here are independently selected by our editors and writers. If you buy something through links on our site, Mashable may earn an affiliate commission.

Credit: Stacey Zhu / Walmart / Mashable composite

Table of Contents

UPDATE: Nov. 25, 2024, 5:00 p.m. EST This story has been updated to reflect that Walmart's Black Friday Deals event is now live for all shoppers.

Walmart's best Black Friday deals at a glance:

Walmart's second Black Friday Deals event kicked off on Monday, Nov. 25 with a $178 55-inch 4K Roku TV, $29 JBL noise-cancelling headphones, and new record-low prices on several Apple gadgets: the AirPods Pro 2 (now $154), the second-generation Apple Watch SE (now $149), the 10th-gen iPad (now $259), the first-gen Apple Pencil (now $59), and the M1 MacBook Air (now $599).

The deals went live on Walmart's website and mobile app at 12 p.m. ET for paid members of its Walmart+ program, then opened to all shoppers at 5 p.m. ET. Several products sold out during the Walmart+ early access period Monday, including $99.99 Beats Solo4 headphones, Lego's The Office set for $70, and $30 copies of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom.

The remaining deals will be up for grabs online through Sunday, Dec. 1 (unless they sell out first) and make their way to stores at 6 a.m. local time on Nov. 29, aka Black Friday proper.

The big-box store joins other major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target in dropping Black Friday deals well ahead of the actual holiday.

Mashable's team of deal-hunting pros knows how to distinguish good discounts from duds (having covered Black Friday sales since 2017), and we're keeping a running list of Walmart's top holiday deals on popular tech and gifts this season. That includes TVs, laptops, headphones, gaming gear, vacuums, beauty tech, and Legos.

Keep scrolling to see our picks — and check back often, as Walmart plans to drop additional deals randomly throughout the week as its Black Friday Deals event progresses. A quick FYI that Walmart doesn't do price matches, but its extended return/exchange policy is in effect through Dec. 31. It covers most items purchased in stores and online.

Frequently Asked Questions

Walmart's first Black Friday Deals event was live online from Monday, Nov. 11 through Sunday, Nov. 17, popping up in stores on Friday, Nov. 15. The sale included doorbusters like a $138 50-inch 4K TV, a $378 75-inch 4K TV, heavily discounted refurbished Dyson hair tools (which sold out fast), a $30 Keurig, $69 Beats headphones, and all-time lows on the new Apple Watch Series 10, the AirPods 3, the Apple AirTag, and the Dyson V12 Detect Slim. (That's Mashable's favorite Dyson vacuum.)

Walmart stores will be open from 6 a.m. to 11 p.m. local time on Black Friday (Nov. 29). The doorbusters from its Black Friday Deals event won't be available in-person until then.

Walmart stores will be closed on Thanksgiving.

Walmart will conclude its holiday programming with a Cyber Monday sale that starts on Sunday, Dec. 1 at 5 p.m. ET for Walmart+ members and 8 p.m. ET for everyone else. That event will run through Cyber Monday proper on Dec. 2 and feature the following deals, among many others:

  • Sony 75-inch Class Bravia 4K TV — $898 $1,498 (Save $600)

  • Ninja Grand Kitchen System 1200 — $98 (Special Buy)

  • Cricut Air 2 Bundle — $179 $269 (save $90)

  • Intex 6-Person PureSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Spa Set — $499.99 $749.99 (save $250)

  • Lego Star Wars Darth Vader Helmet — $48.98 $79.99 (save $31.01)

Haley Henschel is a Chicago-based Senior Shopping Reporter at Mashable who reviews and finds deals on popular tech, from laptops to gaming consoles and VPNs. She has years of experience covering shopping holidays and can tell you what’s actually worth buying on Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day. Her work has also explored the driving forces behind digital trends within the shopping sphere, from dupes to 12-foot skeletons.

Haley received a B.A. in Journalism from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and honed her sifting and winnowing skills at The Daily Cardinal. She previously covered politics for The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, investigated exotic pet ownership for Wisconsin Watch, and blogged for some of your favorite reality stars.

In her free time, Haley enjoys playing video games, drawing, taking walks on Lake Michigan, and spending time with her parrot (Melon) and dog (Pierogi). She really, really wants to get back into horseback riding. You can follow her on X at @haleyhenschel or reach her via email at [email protected].
